required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Monthly Replacement Therapy With Recombinant Factor XIII (rFXIII) in Paediatric Subjects With Congenital Factor XIII A-subunit Deficiency
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Centre, Multinational, Open-Label, Single-Arm and Multiple Dosing Trial on Safety and Efficacy of Monthly Replacement Therapy With Recombinant Factor XIII (rFXIII) in Paediatric Subjects With Congenital Factor XIII A-subunit Deficiency. Safety Extension Trial to F13CD-3760

brief_summary.textblock:
This trial will be conducted in Asia, Europe and the United States of America (USA).
The aim of this clinical trial is to investigate long-term safety of rFXIII when administered for prevention of bleeding episodes in children aged between 1 and 6 years with congenital FXIII A-subunit deficiency. This trial is an extension to trial F13CD-3760 (mentor™4, NCT01230021). If applicable the trial will be extended up to maximum 3 years dependent on when recombinant factor XIII will be commercially available in subject's respective country for use in children of 1-6 years of age.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Treatment Emergent (Serious and Non-serious) Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to end of trial visit (week 173) for a minimum period of 52 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event was described as any untoward medical occurrence in a subject or clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product, and which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Treatment emergent adverse events (serious and non-serious), defined as adverse events occurring from first trial product administration to the end of the subject's participation in the trial.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Development of Anti-rFXIII Antibodies, Including Inhibitors.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to end of trial visit (week 173).
secondary_outcome.description: All subjects who received rFXIII were monitored for the frequency of development of anti-rFXIII antibodies. Samples passed through 2 tiers of ELISA testing: an initial screen with a specific cut-off point (including ~5% false positives) and a second confirmatory assay for samples yielding a result above the screening cut-off point. If samples were confirmed as antibody positive in the confirmation assay, an inhibitor assay was also carried out to detect functional inhibitors.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6th month, from week 24 to end of trial visit (week 173).
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical laboratory assessments for creatinine at week 24 to end of trial visit.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6th month, week 24 to end of trial visit (week 173).
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical laboratory assessments for urea at week 24 to end ot trial visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Laboratory Assessments: Biochemistry: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALAT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6th month, from week 24 to end of trial visit (week 173).
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical laboratory assessments for ALAT at week 24 to end of trial visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Laboratory Assessments: Biochemistry: Aspartate Aminotransferase (ASAT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6th month, from week 24 to end of trial visit (week 173).
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical laboratory assessments for ASAT at week 24 to end of trial visit.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to end of trial visit (week 173).
secondary_outcome.description: Values collected for systolic BP from week 0 to end of trial visit.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to end of trial visit (week 173).
secondary_outcome.description: Values collected for pulse from week 0 to end of trial visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate (Number Per Subject Year) of All Bleeding Episodes Requiring Treatment With a FXIII Containing Product Other Than Recombinant Factor XIII.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 0 to end of trial visit (week 173).
secondary_outcome.description: The rate (number per subject year) of all spontaneous, traumatic and intracranial bleeding episodes requiring treatment with FXIII-containing products during the rFXIII treatment period was assessed for treatment period.

intervention.description: Intravenous injection of a single dose of recombinant factor XIII, 35 IU/kg body weight every 4th week

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Completed participation in trial F13CD-3760 (NCT01230021)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known or suspected hypersensitivity to trial product or related products
- Known history of development of inhibitors against FXIII (factor XIII)
- Hereditary or acquired coagulation disorder other than FXIII congenital deficiency
- Platelet count (thrombocytes) less than 50X10e9 / L
- Previous history of autoimmune disorder involving autoantibodies e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus
- Previous history of arterial or venous thromboembolic events e.g., cerebrovascular accident or deep vein thrombosis
- Any disease or condition which, judged by the trial physician, could imply a potential hazard to the subject, interfere with the trial participation or trial outcome including renal and/or liver dysfunction

facility.name: Novo Nordisk Clinical Trial Call Center
Novo Nordisk Clinical Trial Call Center

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The trial was conducted at 5 sites in 3 countries as follows: Israel (IS): 1 site; United Kingdom (UK): 2 sites; and United States (US): 2 sites.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects who completed the F13CD-3760 (NCT01230021) trial were eligible to get enrolled in this trial.

group.title: rFXIII 35 IU/kg
group.description: Subjects received 35 IU/kg recombinant factor XIII (rFXIII) slow intravenous (i.v.) administered every 4 weeks (28 ± 2 days) as preventive treatment of bleeding episodes. Each dose was reconstituted, diluted with saline and injection was given at a rate not exceeding 1-2 mL min-1. This dose was identical to the dose administered in the trial F13CD-3760. The correct dosing was calculated based on subject's body weight. Subjects received rFXIII either at the clinic during the first year or as home treatment after one year, and only if allowed, according to local regulations.

baseline.population: The safety analysis set (SAS) included all patients exposed to trial drug (rFXIII).

Subjects received rFXIII either at the clinic during the first year or as home treatment after one year, and only if allowed, according to local regulations.

outcome.title: Number of Treatment Emergent (Serious and Non-serious) Adverse Events
outcome.description: An adverse event was described as any untoward medical occurrence in a subject or clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product, and which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Treatment emergent adverse events (serious and non-serious), defined as adverse events occurring from first trial product administration to the end of the subject’s participation in the trial.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to end of trial visit (week 173) for a minimum period of 52 weeks.
outcome.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the trial product.

measure.title: Number of Treatment Emergent (Serious and Non-serious) Adverse Events

Treatment emergent adverse events (serious and non-serious), defined as adverse events occurring from first trial product administration to the end of the subject’s participation in the trial.
measure.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the trial product.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects With Development of Anti-rFXIII Antibodies, Including Inhibitors.
outcome.description: All subjects who received rFXIII were monitored for the frequency of development of anti-rFXIII antibodies. Samples passed through 2 tiers of ELISA testing: an initial screen with a specific cut-off point (including ~5% false positives) and a second confirmatory assay for samples yielding a result above the screening cut-off point. If samples were confirmed as antibody positive in the confirmation assay, an inhibitor assay was also carried out to detect functional inhibitors.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to end of trial visit (week 173).
outcome.population: The SAS included all subjects who received at least one dose of the trial product. There were no antibodies against rFXIII detected in any patient during the trial.

outcome.title: Physical Examinations
outcome.description: Number of subjects in percentage with changes in values of physical examinations from week 0 to end of trial visit were collected.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to end of trial visit (week 173).
outcome.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the trial product. Two abnormal physical examination findings related to skin and musculo-skeletal system were assessed as clinically significant by the investigator during the trial.

outcome.title: Rate (Number Per Subject Year) of All Bleeding Episodes Requiring Treatment With a FXIII Containing Product Other Than Recombinant Factor XIII.
outcome.description: The rate (number per subject year) of all spontaneous, traumatic and intracranial bleeding episodes requiring treatment with FXIII-containing products during the rFXIII treatment period was assessed for treatment period.
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 0 to end of trial visit (week 173).
outcome.population: There were no bleeding episodes requiring treatment with a haemostatic agent (rFXIII) during the trial, which included subjects from full analysis set who received at least one dose of the trial product.

group.title: rFXIII 35 IU/kg
group.description: Subjects received 35 IU/kg recombinant factor XIII (rFXIII) slow intravenous (i.v.) administered every 4 weeks (28 ± 2 days) as preventive treatment of bleeding episodes. Each dose was reconstituted, diluted with saline and injection was given at a rate not exceeding 1-2 mL min-1. This dose was identical to the dose administered in the trial F13CD-3760. The correct dosing was calculated based on subject's body weight. Subjects received rFXIII either at the clinic during the first year or as home treatment after one year, and only if allowed, according to local regulations.

measure.title: Rate (Number Per Subject Year) of All Bleeding Episodes Requiring Treatment With a FXIII Containing Product Other Than Recombinant Factor XIII.
measure.description: The rate (number per subject year) of all spontaneous, traumatic and intracranial bleeding episodes requiring treatment with FXIII-containing products during the rFXIII treatment period was assessed for treatment period.
measure.population: There were no bleeding episodes requiring treatment with a haemostatic agent (rFXIII) during the trial, which included subjects from full analysis set who received at least one dose of the trial product.

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events were collected and reported from screening (visit 1) and until the end of trial visit for a minimum period of 52 weeks.
reported_events.desc: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the trial product (rFXIII).

group.title: rFXIII 35 IU/kg
group.description: Subjects received 35 IU/kg recombinant factor XIII (rFXIII) slow intravenous (i.v.) administered every 4 weeks (28 ± 2 days) as preventive treatment of bleeding episodes. Each dose was reconstituted, diluted with saline and injection was given at a rate not exceeding 1-2 mL min-1. This dose was identical to the dose administered in the trial F13CD-3760. The correct dosing was calculated based on subject's body weight. Subjects received rFXIII either at the clinic during the first year or as home treatment after one year, and only if allowed, according to local regulations.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk maintains the right to be informed of any Investigator plans for publication and to review any scientific paper, presentation, communication or other information concerning the investigation described in this protocol. Any such communication must be submitted in writing to the Novo Nordisk trial manager prior to submission for comments. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the planned communication.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Limitations of the trial included the small number of subjects analysed and the sensitivity of the Berichrom® FXIII activity assay. However, congenital FXIII deficiency is a rare disease and there were no bleeds requiring haemostatic treatment.
